title: The 70th UN General Assembly - as it happened - BBC News
summary: world leaders are addressing the 70th annual united nations general assembly in new york .
assembly set to be dominated by the conflict in syria and the threat from islamic state .
us president barack obama says washington is prepared to work with russia and iran to try to end war in syria .
russian president vladimir putin said it would be a mistake to refuse to co-operate with syrian government .
mr obama and mr putin are due to hold first face-to-face talks in nearly a year .

documents.title: that 's all for now
text: this concludes the bbc 's live coverage of the un general assembly .
the summit is ongoing , and presidents obama and putin are slated to meet at 17:05 local time ( 22:05 bst ) .
you can continue to find the latest developments here .

documents.title: what 's happened so far
text: just to recap what 's happened today
the us and russia have laid bare their profound differences over a solution in syria , namely on the issue of president bashar al-assad .
russia said it would be an `` enormous mistake '' not to work with him to eradicate islamic state ( is ) militants .
that speech by president putin came an hour after president obama called mr assad a tyrant .
but the us leader said he was prepared to work with russia to resolve the conflict .

documents.title: why the unga matters
text: so what is this event all about anyway ?
bbc new york correspondent nick bryant explains what the un general assembly is - and why it matters .
click here for video .

documents.title: smiles for now
text: us president barack obama and russian president vladimir putin seem to have shared an unlikely moment of levity over lunch , ahead of talks .
un secretary-general ban ki-moon looks like he 's more interested in the menu .

documents.title: kerry talks
text: secretary of state john kerry has hosted a meeting with the foreign ministers of uk , france , germany , saudi arabia , jordan , and turkey to discuss syria .

his spokesman john kirby has just told reporters they `` discussed ideas for building renewed and credible diplomatic momentum that could bring an end to the conflict and allow syrians to chart a peaceful future without assad '' .
they will continue discussions over the next few days , he added .

documents.title: 'world has to help refugees '
text: before concluding his remarks , mr hollande said `` the world has to help refugees '' of the conflict in syria .
he decried the fact that international agencies charged with providing for refugees are underfunded .
`` what have we learned these past days and weeks is the unhcr no longer has the means to ensure the necessary support '' for refugees , he said .
he also said that the un food programme did not have sufficient resources to provide for all of the refugees that the crisis has created .

documents.title: syria 'massacre '
text: mr hollande is now on to syria , a conflict that he said has deepened in recent years .

`` let us measure what has not been done , '' he said before noting that when he spoke to the un general assembly about the conflict three years ago , there were 30,000 dead ( compared with 255,000 today ) .
`` at that time there were no terrorists , there were no fundamentalists groups , there was a dictatorship which was massacring people . ''

documents.title: 'saving the planet '
text: with the un 's climate change conference ( known as cop21 ) due in his country in november , mr hollande is addressing climate change in his speech .
`` in paris we will be trying to ask one single question : humankind is it capable to preserve life on this planet ? ''

documents.title: next up , hollande
text: french president francois hollande has begun speaking .
like many other leaders today , he begins his speech noting the history of the united nations .

documents.title: picture with putin
text: pakistan 's permanent representative to the un posts of herself with putin
maleeha lodhi
lodhimaleeha
meeting president putin

documents.title: rouhani exits
text: mr rouhani has exited .
qatar 's sheikh tamim bin hamad al thani has taken the podium .

documents.title: rouhani slams us actions as 'root of terror '
text: mr rouhani has slammed us action in iraq and afghanistan , as well as its support for israel , calling it the origin of today 's conflicts and the source of terrorism .
`` we must not forget that the roots of today 's wars , destruction and terror can be found in the occupation , invasion , and military intervention of yesterday , '' he said .

he continued : `` if we did not have the us military invasion of afghanistan and iraq and the united states 's unwarranted support for the inhumane actions of the zionist regime against the oppressed nation of palestine , today the terrorist would not have an excuse for the justification of their crimes . ''

documents.title: rouhani : 'middle east most turbulent '
text: the middle east and north africa `` has turned into one of the world 's most turbulent regions '' mr rouhani said .
he said that the gravest threat to the world is for `` terrorist organisations to become terrorist states '' .
`` we are prepared to assist in the eradication of terrorism , '' he said .
`` we are prepared to bring about democracy in syria as well as yemen . ''

documents.title: rouhani pays respects to those who died in hajj stampede
text: mr rouhani has begun his remarks by offering his respects to the hundreds killed in a stampede during the hajj in saudi arabia last week .
he also attacked saudi arabia 's `` incompetence and mismanagement '' over the disaster .

documents.title: park exits , hassan rouhani enters
text: ms park has finished her remarks .
iran 's president , hassan rouhani , has begun speaking .

documents.title: park : fight against climate change an economic boost
text: president park geun-hye of south korea is now speaking , and among other to addressed climate change .
`` dealing with climate change is an urgent task that we can no longer afford to put off , '' she says .
`` i believe that addressing climate change is not a burden , '' she adds , noting that efforts to fight it could be an economic boon .

documents.title: putin finishes
text: mr putin has finished his remarks .
the highlight of his speech was his call for a broad coalition against terrorism .
he said it was `` an enormous mistake '' to refuse to co-operate with the syrian government and its troops in their fight against islamic state militants .

he said russia , as the current president of the un security council , would seek agreement on a resolution aimed at co-ordinating the actions of all the forces that confront islamic state and other terrorist organisations .

documents.title: putin : economic 'rules of game changed '
text: `` the rules of the game have been changed in favour of a narrow group of the privileged , '' mr putin has said of the global economy and world trade .
he also said unilateral sanctions were contradictory to the principals of the united nations .

documents.title: putin : 'only assad fighting is '
text: mr putin has said : `` no-one but [ president ] assad 's forces are truly fighting is and other terrorist groups in syria . ''
he later addressed muslim spiritual leaders saying that their guidance was essential in preventing people from joining extremist groups .

documents.title: putin : 'is seeking dominance '
text: mr putin says the so-called islamic state is `` seeking dominance in the islamic world '' .
but he has gone on to criticise efforts to confront the threat .
americas bureaux chief , paul danahar :
paul danahar
pdanahar
putin : countries full of `` self conceit and exceptionality '' have caused the mess in the middle east .
another swipe at us
bbc washington producer , suzanne kianpour :
suzanne kianpour
kianpourworld
# russia pres putin # unga speech jabs at us `` interference '' in mideast & n africa : `` do you realise now what you 've done ? ''

documents.title: king abdullah finishes , putin enters
text: mr abdullah has concluded his remarks , and russian president vladimir putin has taken the podium .
the bbc 's suzanne kianpour with a summary :
suzanne kianpour
kianpourworld
# jordan 's king abdullah at # unga speech , in english , largely focused on # isis , urges against allowing `` extremists to monopolise our media ''

documents.title: abdullah : 'haunted by the images '
text: king abdullah has told gathered world leaders : `` today we are haunted by the images of thousands of refugees . ''
`` we have been taking a significant part of the burden '' of the refugee crisis , he said , noting that international support has been lacking .
`` it is high time the international community acts collectively in facing this unprecedented crisis '' .

documents.title: king abdullah ii : 'third world war'philip j crowley : fellow at the george washington university institute for public diplomacy
text: philip j. crowley
pjcrowley
king abdullah of # jordan calls the struggle against violent extremism a third world war and must be waged with the same intensity .
# unga2015

documents.title: king of jordan is up next
text: jordan 's king abdullah ii is addressing the general assembly in english .
from the very start , he talks about religious extremism .
`` i 'm here as a father who wants his children to live in a more compassionate world , '' he said .

documents.title: xi : 'china will never pursue hegemony '
text: speaking through a translator and addressing his country 's growing influence , mr xi said : `` china will never pursue hegemony , expansion or sphere of influence '' .
a few minutes later he suggested china could lead when it comes to development .
`` we welcome other countries to join china 's express train of development '' .

documents.title: xi on the environment
text: `` to build a sound ecology is vital for mankind 's future , '' mr xi said , addressing the subject of the environment .
`` we should respect nature , follow nature 's ways , and protect nature , '' he said .
`` we should firmly pursue sustainable development '' .
he also called on developed countries to help developing countries mitigate the affects of climate change .

documents.title: xi calls for action
text: mr xi calls on the world 's leaders to `` translate our commitments into actions '' when it comes to the recently-adopted un sustainable development goals .

documents.title: xi : 'past can not be changed '
text: `` the past can not be changed , but the future can be shaped , '' mr xi said .
he went on to say that the un , drawing on lessons of the past , needs to address how to better promote peace and development in the 21st century .
`` in today 's world , all countries are interdependent and share a common future . ''

documents.title: china 's xi takes the podium
text: chinese president xi jinping takes to the stage , and - like mr obama - acknowledges the history of the united nations .
he said the un `` ushered in a new era of co-operation '' when it was founded 70 years ago .

documents.title: polish president finishes
text: mr duda has just finished a wide-ranging speech , that highlighted among other things human rights and poland 's efforts to address climate change .

documents.title: 'strongest nation'barbara plett , bbc state department correspondent
text: barbara plett
bbcbarbaraplett
# obama speech a pitch for intl rule of law and democracy : that 's what allowed us to become strongest nation in the world # unga

documents.title: main points from obama 's speech
text: main points from obama 's speech

documents.title: lesson from poland
text: polish president andrzej duda is speaking now , invoking the country 's suffering during world war two and under communism , and emphasising the need to respect international law .

documents.title: going forwards jon sopel , bbc north america editor
text: jon sopel
bbcjonsopel
# obama says 'i believe in moving forwards not backwards . '
am dying to hear a speech from politicians which says the opposite # unga

documents.title: obama condemns oppressive leaders
text: staying on the theme of individual rights and democracy , mr obama has slammed totalitarian leaders who oppress their people .
`` history shows that regimes who fear their own people will eventually crumble , '' he said .
`` but strong institutions built on the consent of the governed endure long after any one individual is gone .
`` inclusive democracy makes countries stronger . ''

documents.title: 'compromise needed'barbara plett , bbc state department correspondent
text: barbara plett
bbcbarbaraplett
# obama : realism dictates that compromise needed to end # syria fighting , but also requires a managed transition away from # assad # unga

documents.title: russian riposte ?
text: russian foreign minister sergey lavrov is seen making notes as president obama uses his speech at the general assembly to criticise russian foreign policy .

documents.title: obama 'will work with russia and iran '
text: he said the us was prepared to work with any nation - and named russia and iran specifically - to resolve the syrian conflict but stressed there could not be a return to the pre-war status quo .
`` nowhere is our commitment to international order more tested than in syria , '' mr obama said .

documents.title: obama on power
text: mr obama 's speech is also touching on the rights of individuals .
`` the measure of strength is no longer defined by the control of territory , '' he told other leaders .
`` the strength of nations depends on their people . ''

documents.title: iran deal 'shows strength of system'josh lederman , ap white house correspondent
text: josh lederman
joshledermanap
@ barackobama at un cites @ twitterid as example of the `` strength of the international system when it works the way it should ''

documents.title: applause for obama
text: mr obama has said he 's confident the economic embargo the us has levied against cuba will be lifted .
the audience broke into applause for the first time during his speech .
`` for fifty years the united states pursued a cuba policy that failed to improve the lives of cuban people , '' he said .

documents.title: 'pointed at russia'paul danahar , bbc americas bureaux chief
text: paul danahar
pdanahar
seems to me obama 's speech is all pointed at russia & its attempt to rebuild cold war divisions through client states & aggressive coercion .
paul danahar
pdanahar
now obama is naming russia on ukraine issue with quite forceful criticism at unga .
long time since us v russia has dominated an unga

documents.title: obama : 'we have to work together '
text: mr obama has gone on to call for greater collaboration among nations in the future .
`` if we can not work together more effectively , we will all suffer the consequences , '' he said .
`` the united states can not solve the world 's problems alone '' .

documents.title: 'old ways '
text: after reflecting on what the un has achieved , barack obama says we can not return to the `` old ways of conflict and coercion '' .
`` we can not look backwards , '' he adds .

documents.title: obama talks history
text: us president barack obama 's speech starts off on a historical note , saying that un has helped avoid conflict .

documents.title: putin 'has touched down'neil macfarquhar , ny times moscow bureau chief
text: neil macfarquhar
neilmacfarquhar
looks like # putin stepping off the plane at the very moment # obama starts speaking putin coming down stairs now .
met by un amb churkin

documents.title: obama speaks
text: us president barack obama is now addressing the assembly .

documents.title: brazilian pledge
text: brazilian president dilma rousseff has been addressing the general assembly .
she has listed her country 's achievements in its fight against poverty and corruption , and affirmed its commitment to democracy .

documents.title: potus is in the buildingmargaret besheer , voice of america un correspondent
text: margaret besheer
mbesheer
president obama @ twitterid motorcade has arrived # unga he speaks next .
# voaalert

documents.title: 'raise your game '
text: the un secretary general also talked about climate change in his inaugural speech .
he warned that greenhouse gas targets submitted by individual states are not enough to avert harmful climate change .
the world faced a choice , he said .
either it could raise its ambition to tackle climate change - or risk raising temperatures above the two-degree threshold that scientists warn must not be crossed .

documents.title: lockdownlyse doucet , bbc chief international correspondent
text: lyse doucet
bbclysedoucet
`` shut it down '' - when you hear security forces around # unga entrances you know @ twitterid is arriving

documents.title: syrian puzzlepaul danahar , bbc americas bureaux chief
text: an extract from mr ban 's inaugural speech names the five countries that hold the key to open the deadlock on the syrian crisis .
paul danahar
pdanahar
took 4 years but at least the un now recognises it & arab league etc all hopeless observers in the syrian power play

documents.title: plans for syria
text: moscow has already suggested there are plans to form an international contact group on syria that will include russia , the us , iran , turkey and other regional powers .

documents.title: russian media abuzz
text: vladimir putin will deliver his speech to the un later on monday and it has top billing in the russian media .
one television channel has said he is `` preparing a speech that will change the world '' .

documents.title: cash crisisunited nations
text: united nations
un
the global # humanitarian system is not broken ; it is broke .
we are not receiving enough money to save enough lives .
- ban ki-moon to # unga

documents.title: 'strong passions '
text: ban ki moon urged all countries to do more to solve the migrant crisis :
`` people are on the move as never before .
these flows raise complex issues and rouse strong passions .
all countries need to do more to uphold their responsibilities .
we must crack down on traffickers . ''

documents.title: inaugural address
text: the inaugural address by un secretary general ban ki-moon is under way - he 's speaking about the migrant crisis in europe .

documents.title: game-changer for syria ? lyse doucet , bbc chief international correspondent
text: lyse doucet
bbclysedoucet
great interest in what # putin says about # syria today - does russia 's military engagement help break a deadlock or reinforce it ?
# unga

documents.title: it 's not all diplomacy
text: many leaders are already in new york , having travelled to the city for a major un development summit that ended over the weekend .
on sunday , french president francois hollande took a break from his meetings to pose with dancers from the `` moulin rouge '' show on broadway .

documents.title: centre stage for putin
text: russian president vladimir putin is to hold rare talks with us president barack obama to outline his proposals for ending the conflict in syria .
mr putin will also give a speech at the assembly .
relations between russia and the west have been strained over the conflict in ukraine .

documents.title: why the un matters
text: here 's an explainer from the bbc 's nick bryant on what the un general assembly is - and why it matters .

documents.title: welcome
text: hello and welcome to our live coverage of the 70th un general assembly meeting in new york .
world leaders from more than 150 countries are attending , and the syrian conflict is top of the agenda .
